subject: Re: [junit] Dinamic tests with JUnit
msgSnippet: Do you know where I can find an example on how to use it with JUnit 3? Thanks ... -- Emerson Cargnin [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Do you know where I can find an example on how to use it with JUnit 3?

Thanks

On 5/22/07, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> It's a pattern that can be used in JUnit 3, and has explicit support in
> JUnit 4.
>
> David Saff
>
> On 5/22/07, Emerson Cargnin <echofloripa@...<echofloripa%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> > is that specific of junit 4?
> >
> > On 5/22/07, David Saff <saff@... <saff%40mit.edu>> wrote:
> > >
> > > Emerson,
> > >
> > > Have you Googled for Parameterized Test Case? That might be the
> > > solution you're looking for. Please let me know if that's not enough
> > > to get you started,
> > >
> > > David Saff
> > >
> > >
> > > On 5/22/07, Emerson <echofloripa@... <echofloripa%40gmail.com><echofloripa%
> 40gmail.com>>
> > > wrote:
> > > > hey all, does anyone know how I could execute dinamic tests methods
> > > > using Junit? I mean, I have a framework that uses xml configuration
> > > > and XPATH to make some assertion tests from our server, and I would
> > > > like to run them using junit, as it would be easier to generate
> > > > reports and so on. The problem is that the tests are dinamic and
> > > > depend on an external configuration file. So if i do asserts inside
> a
> > > > loop it would leave the method on the first fail/error, is there any
> > > > way to store all the asserts and process them afterwards? what would
> > > > you suggest?
> > > >
> > > > thanks
> > > > emerson
> > > >
